poem:
Title: Unseen Roots of Discord

Beneath the city's pulse,
Gove stirs the pot—chance or fate?
Groups unnamed, under the new
cloak of extremism's weight.

Sadiq Khan, lone voice of worry,
Foresees roots driven deep, unseen.
Divisions widen, not lessened,
In the soil of this political scene.

Words engaged, concrete and real,
Warnings drowned in government din.
Policy, an architect designing shadows, 
Within, the danger begins.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative.
